intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. bathylepium, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a perennial herb with a rosette of basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellow composite flowers. The plant has a hairy stem and leaves that are typically lance-shaped and serrated. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it well adapted to cold, harsh environments.
